meanings.definition: The quality of being trustworthy or reliable.
meanings.sent1: Her trustiness in keeping secrets made her a great friend.
meanings.sent2: The company's success was built on the trustiness of its products.
meanings.sent3: His trustiness in always returning borrowed items promptly was legendary.
meanings.sent4: The old watch had a certain trustiness about it, despite its age.
meanings.sent5: The trustiness of the dog's loyalty was unmatched.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being deserving of trust.
meanings.sent1: The politician's trustiness was questioned after the scandal.
meanings.sent2: In a relationship, both partners should strive for trustiness.
meanings.sent3: The trustiness of the weather forecast was put to the test during the storm.
meanings.sent4: The foundation of their friendship was built on trustiness.
meanings.sent5: The trustiness of the mechanic's work was evident in the smooth running of the car.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being honest and dependable.
meanings.sent1: His trustiness in always telling the truth was admired by all.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's trustiness was evident in the way students confided in her.
meanings.sent3: The trustiness of the GPS system saved them from getting lost on the road trip.
meanings.sent4: The trustiness of the old oak tree provided shade for generations.
meanings.sent5: The trustiness of the recipe ensured a delicious meal every time.
